item.title: Why I Hope I Get to Write a Lot of Elm Code in 2025
item.description: In a world dominated by React, Vue, and Svelte, it might seem strange to highlight Elm â€“ a niche language that has existed since 2012 but has had fewer releases since then than React has in a year. But right now, when frontend development is becoming increasingly complex, and clients are doing heavy lifting that previously belonged on the other side of an API call, it’s worth taking a closer look at what Elm does right.
